name: The Scarlet Hotel

reviews.text: A friend & I stayed here for one night & the place left us wanting more!
reviews.title: Left us wanting more...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the room with an amazing view & balcony to the treatments with the short journeys making us feel so good & made us even more relaxed to the food that was just delicious with every mouth full, to the incredible staff who made us feel so welcome that it didn't feel like we were at a hotel but in someone's lovely home!
reviews.title: Romantic escape

reviews.text: And the amazing sunset we were treated to in the restaurant really added to how special this place is.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel, lovely people!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh I could go on forever gushing about this hotel but it really did leave us wanting more & that one night was just not enough. When a place makes you feel like this, then they really are doing something right!
reviews.title: Best location and service from any hotel I have stayed at...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This has to be the most romantic place for couples in Cornwall. It holds a very special place in my heart having visited a few times for spa days and overnight stays and husband choosing this as the place to propose to me. It was also the place where we spent the first night of our 'staycation honeymoon' before visiting the Isles of Scilly.
reviews.title: Amazing weekend away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple

reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.title: Perfect getaway

reviews.text: Highly recommended - however an expensive treat - but that keeps it exclusive.
reviews.title: Escape to the sea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will be back.
reviews.title: Remote, stunning, expensive and quirky.. all quirks welcome

reviews.text: My wife and I recently booked in for 2 nights to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary and we couldn't have picked a better place to do so. We ended up extending our stay as we loved it so much. Yes, it's expensive but you get what you pay for ! The rooms and the public areas are beautiful, clean and comfortable. The hotel has a number of quirks - they like "to challenge convention" such as no reception desk and no tea/coffee in the room but they will deliver to your room on request. The pool is "natural" so has no chlorine but contains plants that naturally keep it clean. For frequent hotel dwellers it may take a little getting used to but you will soon fall under the spell of this place. Dinner in the restaurant was superb and the local Cornish wines were a real surprise. The breakfast menu changed daily and everything was freshly cooked and delicious. The views from the hotel's several balcony areas across the beach and the bay are just stunning and we were lucky to get a couple of amazing sunsets. Every single member of staff was friendly, helpful and knowledgable who's aim was to help you relax and enjoy your stay. If was to find a couple of minor faults, there probably weren't enough exterior sunbeds around the pool area and it seemed a little excessive charging hotel guests£15 to go in the hot tubs. However, we will definitely return to this hotel when we can as it is amazing.
reviews.title: wonderfully relaxing
Another fantastic stay
reviews.text: This was our third stay and as ever The Scarlet struck a perfect balance between excellent service with a relaxed atmosphere in a fabulous setting. It is a haven from the stress of the outside world. The spa is wonderful offering a tranquil environment with wonderful therapists. I would recommend the outdoor hot tubs to make the most of the spectacular views. All rooms overlook the sea and it is sublime to wake up to the sound of the waves breaking on the beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As this hotel has been placed into the trip advisors traveller's choice and is ranked as a 5 star, I compared this stay against my experiences at the Shangri-La Rasa Ria in Kota Kinabalu, Shangri-La in Bangkok and the Ritz Carlton in Doha.
reviews.title: A special place

reviews.text: We arrived for a 2-night stay at the Scarlet over the May bank holiday weekend; we arrived at 2am to a warm welcome. I also noted no parking problems with my car either although, the hotel was full, there was no need to hand over my car keys to the staff (on this occasion).
reviews.title: Pure Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property itself is a design study in functional minimalism; the architect who designed this hotel is a genius. What you cannot see from the photos is the general sense of space and calmness, which exudes from just standing in the lobby. On a nice day, I challenge anyone with a heartbeat to stand in the lobby, looking out over that infinity pool and not be inspired by what you see.
reviews.title: A perfect short-break

reviews.text: We stayed in one of the more basic double rooms with a balcony, set back from the rear of the hotel. I must say I really enjoyed the room, lots of wood and the simple design ethos found in the main reception is carried on through here.
reviews.title: Relaxing stay at the Scarlet!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We treated ourselves to a couples spa journey with overnight stay including dinner.
reviews.title: A lovely hotel in a beautiful spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a fantastic day we had, quiet and relaxing at a very leisurely pace with one of the best massages I have had in a long time. The hotel is beautifully designed and the staff are attentive and friendly without being intrusive. The food, all locally supplied where possible, was delicious with impeccable service and wine reasonably priced. All added up to be a fantastic mini break and I would urge you to consider The Scarlet next time you want to escape for a day or two.
reviews.title: A piece of heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks you guys we will be back
reviews.title: One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent three nights here, and we didn't want to leave.
reviews.title: A special mention for Pete, the maintenance man

reviews.text: The hotel's beautiful location is, of course, an excellent start. Who could fail to fall in love with that view? But what makes this place extra special is the interior, which will blow you away, and the staff, all of whom are amazing.
reviews.title: Fantastic!!

aka: The Scarlet Hotel Mawgan Porth, Cornwall
description: Simply put, we are a beautiful 37 bedroom hotel built to the highest eco standards, boasting delicious locally sourced food and the best Ayurvedic inspired spa you can imagine.Discover an escape for grown-ups, to eat, dream and play in peace.
